tier1_neural.reason: Report file truncated at 182 bytes - tests not completed

tier3_cellular.notes: 8e conservation test failed - Df x alpha deviates 27.2% from target

scale_invariance.description: Test if R values have low CV across scales (intensivity)

results.notes: High CV due to different R computation methods at each scale. Molecular uses structure-based R, gene expression uses expression-variance R.

scale_invariance.reason: CV=1.379 exceeds threshold of 0.3. However, this may reflect different R definitions rather than true scale variance.

8e_universality.description: Test if Df x alpha = 8e (21.746) holds across scales with CV < 15%
8e_universality.reason: CV=55.5% exceeds 15% threshold. Only gene_expression tier is within 15% of 8e target.

blind_cross_scale_transfer.description: Test if R formula from one scale predicts outcomes at another without retuning

gene_expression_cross_species.description: R formula transfers across species (human to yeast)

molecular_binding_causality.description: Delta-R predicts mutation effects across protein families

blind_cross_scale_transfer.reason: 3/3 cross-modal transfer tests passed with r/similarity > 0.3

criterion_1.notes: CV=1.379 but this reflects different R formulations per scale, not true non-intensivity

criterion_2.notes: CV=55.5%. Molecular scale shows Df*alpha=4.16 far from 8e target. Cellular shows 27.65.

criterion_4.description: At least 1 blind cross-scale transfer works (r > 0.3)

verdict.summary: R = E/sigma works at intermediate biological scales but with important caveats
findings: R formula successfully predicts outcomes within each scale (91.7% test pass rate)
Cross-scale transfer works for related domains (gene expression across species, mutations across proteins)
8e conservation law does NOT universally hold - Df x alpha varies from 4.16 (molecular) to 27.65 (cellular)
R magnitude is NOT scale-invariant - values differ by ~80x between molecular and gene expression scales
The formula R = E/sigma captures meaningful information at each scale but requires scale-specific calibration
implications: R is a useful intensive-like quantity within a scale, but not a true universal constant across scales
8e conservation appears specific to semantic/neural scales, not molecular/cellular
Cross-scale transfer requires domain adaptation, not raw parameter transfer
recommendations: Complete Tier 1 (neural) tests to get full picture
Investigate why 8e appears at gene expression but not molecular scale
Consider scale-specific R normalization for cross-scale comparisons
